title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Philippines Cybersecurity Solutions, through Business Council for International Understanding

description.narrative: This USTDA-funded reverse trade mission (RTM) will familiarize up to fifteen public sector representatives from the Philippines with the latest U.S. technologies, services, and best practices for cybersecurity. The RTM will take place over approximately twelve calendar days, and the itinerary will include meetings with relevant U.S. industry representatives, technical organizations, financial institutions, and U.S. government agencies. This USTDA-funded reverse trade mission (RTM) will familiarize up to fifteen public sector representatives from the Philippines I including from the Department of Information and Communications Technology (DICT), the Information and Communications Technology Office (ICTO), and the Philippine National Security Council - with the latest U.S. technologies, services, and best practices for cybersecurity. The RTM will take place over approximately twelve calendar days, and the itinerary will include meetings with relevant U.S. industry representatives, technical organizations, financial institutions,

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Ore-to-Nickel and Cobalt Processing Facility Feasibility Study, through Enterprise - United States Unknown

description.narrative: This grant funds a feasibility study to support Eramen Minerals Inc. (EMI) in assessing the viability of developing an ore-to-nickel and cobalt processing facility to produce battery grade precursor materials in the Philippines. EMI currently operates a nickel ore mining facility in Zambales Province and seeks to develop local capacity to produce approximately 20,000 metric tons of mixed hydroxide precipitate annually for sale as a battery precursor material. The Project would support the production of critical minerals that are key elements in the supply chain for batteries and energy storage systems.

title.narrative: Vessel Traffic Management System Feasibility Study, through Enterprise - United States Unknown

description.narrative: This grant funds a feasibility study to support the Philippines' Department of Transportation (DOTr) in assessing the viability of developing an expanded vessel traffic management system (VTMS) in the Philippines. The Philippine Coast Guard (PCG), an agency under DOTr, inaugurated its first VTMS in 2018 with coverage over the Cebu Strait. As a nation comprised of over 7,000 islands, over 800 commercial ports, and growing vessel traffic activity, the Philippines needs to expand its VTMS capabilities to cover major ports and navigational paths. The feasibility study would assess the viability of potential VTMS implementation at eight (8) to ten (10) selected locations in the Philippines and develop the technical architecture and infrastructure requirements for each location.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - GreenFire Energy Geothermal Pilot Feasibility Study, through Enterprise - United States Unknown

description.narrative: This grant funds a feasibility study (FS) and pilot for Energy Development Corporation (EDC), a private energy developer in the Philippines, to assess the technical and economic viability of utilizing U.S. company GreenFire Energy's (GFE) proprietary technology to increase geothermal power production in EDC's geothermal fields. The FS and pilot will help EDC determine if GFE's technology will help increase production at existing idle wells and newly built wells owned and operated by EDC.

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - MERALCO Power Distribution Modernization Pilot Project, through Government of Philippines

description.narrative: This $442,940 feasibility study grant is supporting Manila Electric Company (MERALCO) to develop the technical scope and implementation plan for a power distribution modernization pilot project that will address its distribution issues and improve customer services. The pilot would install 10,000 smart meters in MERALCOs metro Manila franchise, and is expected to help optimize transmission and distribution services for system-wide implementation of smart grid technologies, and reduce non-payment by customers and distribution losses.

description.narrative: This $599,886 feasibility study is helping Aboitiz Power Corporation (AP) to develop the necessary implementation plans for a power distribution modernization pilot project that would address smart grid solutions for its distribution network reinforcement and reliability, as well as plans to improve customer services. sector.narrative: Electric power transmission and distribution (centralised grids)

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Rural Electrification Distribution Improvement and Financing, through Government of Philippines

description.narrative: This $404,510 technical assistance (TA) activity supported the Rural Electrification Financing Corporation (REFC) to improve distribution systems and implement associated financing plans for rural electrification operations in the Philippines. With proper maintenance and loss control mechanisms in place, and procurement of equipment, materials, and construction practices that meet international standards, distribution services are expected to significantly reduce losses on the grid-based system. Financing plans prepared for presentation to several identified financial participants will help REFC receive implementation financing approval. National Rural Electric Cooperative Association (NRECA) International is the sole-source contractor under a cost-sharing role for completion of the TA.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

sector.narrative: Electric power transmission and distribution (centralised grids)

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Security Vulnerability Assessments for Airports, through Government of Philippines

description.narrative: This $529,850 technical assistance (TA) grant supports the Department of Transport and Communications (DOTC) to conduct security vulnerability assessments at three representative airports in the Philippines. The TA is recommending technical/performance specifications for equipment and implementation plans to modernize and upgrade airport security procedures. This project is expected to serve as a model for broader application throughout the country for more secure and efficient airport operations.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - METEOROLOGICAL AND HYDROLOGICAL TELECOMMUNICATIONS NETWORK UPGRADE PROJECT, through Government of Philippines

description.narrative: This $381,000 Feasibility Study activity supports the Philippine Atmospheric, Geophysical, and Astronomical Services Administration (PAGASA) as it upgrades its meteorological and hydrological telecommunications network (MTS). The MTS will enhance their weather forecast and early warning services and capabilities. The study identifies the specific telecommunications needs of PAGASA and identifies the most appropriate and reliable system design to link PAGASA facilities countrywide and to interconnect with the planned National Broadband Network.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - RURAL ELECTRIFICATION DISTRIBUTION IMPROVEMENT AND FINANCING, through Government of Philippines

description.narrative: This 404,510 technical Assistance (TA) activity supports the Rural Electrification Financing Corporation (REFC) to improve distribution systems and implement associated financing plans for rural electrification operations in the Philippines. With proper maintenance and loss control mechanisms in place, and procurement of equipment, materials and construction practices that meet international standards, distribution services are expected to significantly reduce losses on the grid-based system. Financing plans prepared for presentation to several identified financial participants will help REFC receive implementation financing approval. National Rural Electric Cooperative Association (NRECA) International has been identified as the sole-source contractor under a cost-sharing role for completion of the TA.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - FIRST GEN CABADBARAN RUN-OF-RIVER HYDROELECTRIC PROJECT, through Government of Philippines

description.narrative: This $360,000 Feasibility Study supports First Gen Mindanao Hydropower Corporation (FGMHPC), a subsidiary of First Gen Corp., in the Philippines to build a 14-20 MW run-of-river hydroelectric power plant. Electricity demand in the Philippines will nearly double in the ten years from 2004 to 2013, and smaller, alternative energy projects have recently gained significant traction in both the public and private sectors. The project would ease electricity supply issues in the plant's region, and it supports the Philippine Government's thrust of supporting economic development in Mindanao and developing new power plants using indigenous and renewable energy sources.

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Feasibility Study - Waste-to-Energy Facilities, through Government of Philippines

description.narrative: This $646,285 activity partially funds a feasibility study for the construction of two 24 MW waste-to-energy facilities in the Philippines. These facilities, projected to provide power to 64,000 homes, will assist the Philippines in meeting its renewable energy goals, as well as address energy shortfalls and increasing volumes of municipal solid waste. Bacavalley Energy Inc. is the grantee and Sinova Capital is the contractor and shares in the costs of the study.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated end date is the latest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

sector.narrative: Energy generation, renewable sources - multiple technologies

title.narrative: Technical Assistance - Global Procurement Initiative: Procurement Assistance for Philippines: Phase III Procurement Advisors, through Nathan Associates Inc.

description.narrative: This technical assistance grant provides funding for a Procurement Advisor with two Sector Procurement Experts (Advisors) to assist the Philippines Department of Transportation (DOTr). The grant represents Phase III of the Procurement Assistance Program for the Philippines under the Global Procurement Initiative: Understanding Best Value (GPI). The Advisors provide strategic and technical procurement advice on transportation sector procurements, with the goal of incorporating value-based methodologies into DOTr's procurement process. A value-based procurement system will help implement sustainable, high-quality transportation projects and may increase opportunities for U.S. companies to bid on and potentially win transportation tenders.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

title.narrative: GPI: Procurement Assistance for Philippines: Phase III Procurement Advisors, through Nathan Associates Inc.

description.narrative: This technical assistance grant provides funding for a Procurement Advisor with two Sector Procurement Experts to assist the Philippines Department of Transportation. The grant represents Phase III of the Procurement Assistance Program for the Philippines under the Global Procurement Initiative: Understanding Best Value.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

sector.narrative: Democracy, Human Rights, and Governance - General

title.narrative: GPI: Procurement Assistance for Philippines: Phase III Procurement Advisors, through Nathan Associates Inc.

description.narrative: This technical assistance grant provides funding for a Procurement Advisor with two Sector Procurement Experts (Advisors) to assist the Philippines Department of Transportation (DOTr). The grant represents Phase III of the Procurement Assistance Program for the Philippines under the Global Procurement Initiative: Understanding Best Value (GPI). The Advisors provide strategic and technical procurement advice on transportation sector procurements, with the goal of incorporating value-based methodologies into DOTr's procurement process. A value-based procurement system will help implement sustainable, high-quality transportation projects and may increase opportunities for U.S. companies to bid on and potentially win transportation tenders.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

title.narrative: MERALCO Power Distribution Modernization Pilot Project, through Nexant, Inc.

description.narrative: This feasibility study grant would support Manila Electric Company ( MERALCO) to develop the technical scope and implementation plan for a power distribution modernization pilot project that will address its distribution issues and improve customer services. The pilot would install 10,000 smart meters in MERALCOs metro Manila franchise, and is expected to help optimize transmission and distribution services for system-wide implementation of smart grid technologies, and reduce non-payment by customers and distribution losses. This $6,750 contract modification funds the third party invoice and deliverable consultant to assist USTDA with reviewing an additional deliverable and corresponding invoice associated with the Burma Energy Transaction Advisory Services Technical Assistance (USTDA Activity No. 2015-31017A).

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

sector.narrative: Electric power transmission and distribution (centralised grids)
